message:

Give this a try 
http://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm/whatsnew/

worth every penny
story: Muhammad Negm shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: WebStorm 8 â€” Web Intelligence at Your Service
caption: jetbrains.com
description: The most intelligent Web IDE: JavaScript/CSS/HTML Editor with refactorings, code completion and on-the-fly code analysis

data.message: I'm using WebStorm and yea it is very powerful and clean. The only issue in it is that it doesn't have recovery options so if the electricity cut off suddenly (In Egypt this happens a lot :D ) , don't be surprised if you find ur code corrupted.
and this is why kids I use git =D.

You use version control when you finish after you save.I think he meant when the electricity goes off while you are coding. Sublime returns you to the same state before it shut down but that's not a deal breaker for me. I have been using sublime for so long I am more productive with it. I tried webstorm out of curiosity and it's awesome but I didn't feel the turbo charge I am getting from sublime.

Yea , I used git too to avoid this problem but I just wanted to clarify this problem because many people won't find it easy to use git. Also you don't save each second so you may lose some lines of code even if you just saved before the electricity goes off :D
There is no "save" in WebStorm (or other JetBrains IDEs) per se, changes are immediately saved as you type. Could you please elaborate on the electricity problem?
I lost my code two times because of electricity cut off as I find the files corrupted after the electricity is back.
Wow, I should be careful then. I always took WebStorm's ability to immediately save files for granted.
u still can use Microsoft visual studio online for the sake of source code control if u have a team not more than 5 members..I used it once and worked just fine
